newsitem.title: USA: Sangstat trials for Cyclosporine positive.
newsitem.headline: Sangstat trials for Cyclosporine positive.

text.p: SangStat Medical Corp said pivotal trials of its generic Cyclosporine formulation showed it to be bioequivalent to other forms of branded cyclosporine now on the market.
Based on those results, the company said it plans to file for marketing clearance with U.S. Food and Drug Administration by the end of the year, earlier than previously forecast.
Cyclosporine is an immunosuppressive drug used in human organ transplants to prevent graft rejection. A different formulation of the drug is currently marketed by Sandoz Ltd.
SangStat said two formulations of the same drug are considered bioequivalent if they show the same absorption rate, blood concentration and presistence in the bloodstream.

It said FDA allows for the approval of generic drugs based on a demonstration of bioequivalence to an FDA-approved reference drug, without the need to duplicate the safety and efficacy trials conducted on the reference drug.
